what: Writing and uploading files to SharePoint
title: Reading and writing items from SharePoint
text: can use upload_sp_item() upload local file SharePoint folder document library. Using read_sharepoint(), can confirm file uploaded: write_sharepoint() extends upload_sp_item() allowing pass R object instead file path. Like read_sharepoint() tries guess appropriate input function, write_sharepoint() tries guess appropriate output function based object class. wrap example, need remove uploaded files SharePoint keep tidy shared file system. delete_sp_item() supports option use shared item URL select file remove , case, easier set drive argument along relative filepath:
code: folder_url <- "https://bmore.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/MayorsOffice-DataGovernance/Shared%20Documents/RStats?csf=1&web=1&e=S1XxVU"  upload_sp_item(   file = system.file("gpkg/nc.gpkg", package = "sf"),   dest = folder_url ) #> Loading Microsoft Graph login for default tenant sp_drive <- get_sp_drive(folder_url) #> Loading Microsoft Graph login for default tenant  nc <- read_sharepoint(   "RStats/nc.gpkg",   drive = sp_drive )  plot(nc["AREA"]) write_sharepoint(   mtcars,   file = "mtcars.csv",   dest = folder_url ) #> Loading Microsoft Graph login for default tenant # Remove the file delete_sp_item(   file.path("RStats", "nc.gpkg"),   drive = sp_drive,   confirm = FALSE )  delete_sp_item(   file.path("RStats", "mtcars.csv"),   drive = sp_drive,   confirm = FALSE )

title: Reading and writing items from SharePoint
text: know URL file path item SharePoint can also use directory info functions list items typically using sp_dir_info() function. function supports recursive listings can slow depending number items SharePoint library. last example computed shows list remove empty nested directories left failed manual import; Overall, intent package maximize flexibility read write files SharePoint. Suggestions welcome please share tips working Microsoft SharePoint API Microsoft365R package.
code: # List directories dir_info <- sp_dir_info("<SharePoint Folder URL>", type = "directory", recurse = TRUE)  # Filter to empty directories and sort by depth empty_dirs <- dir_info |>   filter(size == 0) |>   mutate(     path_depth = str_count(name, "/")   ) |>   arrange(desc(path_depth))  # Get drive drive <- get_sp_drive(   drive_name = "<SharePoint Document Library Name>",   site_url = "<SharePoint Site URL>" )  # Delete empty directories and skip confirmation walk(   empty_dirs[["id"]],   \(x) {     delete_sp_item(       item_id = x,       drive = drive,       confirm = FALSE     )   } )

title: Reading and writing to SharePoint Lists
text: SharePoint Lists (also known Microsoft Lists) can added SharePoint site created single user. package assumes working lists within SharePoint site. article covers: Reading lists list items Creating lists list items package also supports updating deleting lists list items added article future.

title: Reading and writing to SharePoint Lists
text: Loading Microsoft365R::ms_site object advance optional functions. list_sp_lists() takes site URL returns data frame information site lists: However, loading site using needed recommended avoid duplicate API calls. Use get_sp_site() load site pass object list_sp_lists() multiple lists get_sp_list() return single list. get items list data frame, need use list_sp_list_items() function. function allows pass site list name, list URL place list name site, pass list object directly: can get single list item Microsoft365R::ms_list_item object using get_sp_list_item(). id values visible default looking Microsoft List online included list item data frame:

title: Reading and writing to SharePoint Lists
text: list name site (site URL) requirements create list: However, list created using default template = "genericList" one column: Title. can add column list created. Creating columns required column definition can created using create_column_definition() function one column type-specific variations: create_sp_list_column() takes column definition Microsoft List object adds column list. can specify multiple columns using list data frame parameters (leaving blank values parameter applicable): creating column definitions based existing data frame can alternatively use data_as_column_definition_list(): present, data frames character, numeric, datetime, factor values supported list columns . column definition lists provided columns argument create_sp_list() create columns time list. create_sp_list_items() also allows users create list populate list items single function call setting create_list = TRUE: can use function create_list = FALSE (default) add multiple items list create individual items using create_sp_list_item(). Creating updating large numbers items can slow. creating large number items, can use parallelization feature built-pakage via purrr::in_parallel(). Set number daemons, persistent background processes, handle requests parallel using mirai::daemons() calling create_sp_list_items() process speed .

title: Read and Write from SharePoint Sites
text: {Microsoft365} uses S6 methods nearly everything may difficult users (included) less familiar interface. sharepointr package seeks ease challenge wrapping {Microsoft365} methods adding support specification SharePoint sites, drives, items using SharePoint URLs instead item drive ID values.
code: library(sharepointr)

what: Reading and writing objects to and from SharePoint
title: Read and Write from SharePoint Sites
text: useful functions users may read_sharepoint() write_sharepoint(). read_sharepoint() downloads SharePoint file temporary folder , based file extension, reads environment using appropriate function package (e.g. using officer::read_docx() Microsoft Word files sf::read_sf() common spatial data files): write_sharepoint() saves R object local files uses upload_sp_item() uploads file SharePoint. See vignette("read-write"") information reading writing files SharePoint package.

what: Working with SharePoint items, lists, and plans
title: Read and Write from SharePoint Sites
text: package currently support three main categories SharePoint objects: Items (including directories files) item properties Lists list items Plans tasks Typically functions return ms_object object, list ms_object objects, data frame. cases, data frame based object properties includes list column ms_object stored. example, get_sp_item() returns ms_drive_item object supports parsing shared file folder URLs: Set as_data_frame = TRUE return data frame instead ms_drive_item object: basic functions “get” objects extended functions like download_sp_item() adds support downloading copies SharePoint files (function powers read_sharepoint()): See vignette("read-write"") reading writing items SharePoint. original Microsoft365R S6 object methods already return data frame default list_items list_files methods Microsoft365R::ms_drive object. sp_dir_info() wraps method return data frame similar output fs::dir_info(): Others functions use as_data_frame parameter convert list data frame convenient alternative. functions start list_ return data frame default can return list ms_object class objects as_data_frame = FALSE. creating, updating, deleting large number list items, use mirai::daemons() complete operations parallel. feature uses experimental purrr::in_parallel() function documented : https://purrr.tidyverse.org/reference/map.html See vignette("sp-lists"") reading writing SharePoint list items.

what: Helpers for SharePoint sites and drives
title: Read and Write from SharePoint Sites
text: functions package rely pair helper functions: get_sp_site(), get_sp_drive(), get_sp_item(), can parse URL determine SharePoint site URL, drive name, file path based URL. get_sp_site() minimal wrapper Microsoft365R::get_sharepoint_site(): get_sp_drive() returns ms_drive object required SharePoint URL includes name drive (otherwise returns drive named “sharepointr.default_drive_name” option): See vignette("sp_url"") information package handles URL parsing.
code: site_url <- "https://bmore.sharepoint.com/sites/MayorsOffice-DataGovernance"  get_sp_site(site_url = site_url) #> Loading Microsoft Graph login for default tenant #> <Sharepoint site 'Citywide Data Network'> #>   directory id: bmore.sharepoint.com,1da01cb7-76c7-4487-b398-ec60dff8f52d,7abe409a-2aeb-4eb8-8dc3-8fe9106907af  #>   web link: https://bmore.sharepoint.com/sites/MayorsOffice-DataGovernance  #>   description: If you work with or are interested in data, feel free to join!  #> --- #>   Methods: #>     delete, do_operation, get_analytics, get_drive, get_group, #>     get_list, get_list_pager, get_lists, get_pages, #>     list_columns, list_content_types, list_drives, #>     list_permissions, list_subsites, sync_fields, update get_sp_drive(docx_shared_url) #> Loading Microsoft Graph login for default tenant #> <Document library 'Documents'> #>   directory id: b!txygHcd2h0SzmOxg3_j1LZpAvnrrKrhOjcOP6RBpB6-8Kta613N3QJlbvrVKyTwO  #>   web link: https://bmore.sharepoint.com/sites/MayorsOffice-DataGovernance/Shared%20Documents  #>   description:   #> --- #>   Methods: #>     copy_item, create_folder, create_share_link, delete, #>     delete_item, do_operation, download_file, download_folder, #>     get_item, get_item_properties, get_list_pager, #>     list_activites, list_files, list_items, list_shared_files, #>     list_shared_items, load_dataframe, load_rdata, load_rds, #>     move_item, open_item, save_dataframe, save_rdata, save_rds, #>     set_item_properties, sync_fields, update, upload_file, #>     upload_folder

title: Read and Write from SharePoint Sites
text: similar packages available: sharrpoint: R package interact Sharepoint API (files & lists). sharepointr: R package reading writing SharePoint lists. msgraphr: minimal R wrapper SharePoint Online (Office 365) APIs (last updated 3 years ago). know package name conflicts existing sharepointr package. Unfortunately, didn’t notice find set repository. However, given appears sharepointr package may longer development, plan stick current name time .

code: AzureR_config_ls(path = NULL, glob = "*.json")  AzureR_config_delete(path = NULL, filename = "graph_logins.json")

title: List or delete files from the AzureR configuration directory — AzureR_config
text: path Path configuration directory AzureR package JSON file graph_logins stored. NULL, path set rappdirs::user_config_dir("AzureR"). glob wildcard aka globbing pattern (e.g. *.csv) passed grep() filter paths. filename Filename delete configuration directory. Defaults "graph_logins.json". Set NULL path contains file name.

title: Create a column definition for use with the create column method for SharePoint lists — create_column_definition
code: create_column_definition(   name,   ...,   .col_type = "text",   enforce_unique = NULL,   hidden = FALSE,   deletable = NULL,   indexed = NULL,   sealed = NULL,   propagate_changes = NULL,   read_only = NULL,   required = NULL,   validation = NULL,   default = get_column_default(),   description = NULL,   displayname = NULL,   id = NULL )  create_text_column(   name,   ...,   multiple_lines = NULL,   append_changes = NULL,   lines = NULL,   max_length = NULL,   text_type = c("plain", "richText") )  create_choice_column(   name,   choices,   ...,   allow_text = TRUE,   display_as = c("dropDownMenu", "checkBoxes", "radioButtons"),   allow_na = TRUE,   na_replacement = "NA",   split = NULL )  create_number_column(   name,   ...,   decimals = "automatic",   display_as = NULL,   max = NULL,   min = NULL )  create_datetime_column(   name,   ...,   display_as = c("default", "friendly", "standard"),   format = c("dateOnly", "dateTime") )  create_boolean_column(name, ...)  create_currency_column(name, ..., locale = "en-us")  create_calculated_column(   name,   ...,   formula,   format = c("dateOnly", "dateTime"),   output_type = c("text", "boolean", "currency", "dateTime", "number") )  create_lookup_column(   name,   lookup_list_column,   ...,   lookup_list_id = NULL,   lookup_list = NULL,   allow_multiple = NULL,   allow_unlimited_length = NULL,   primary_lookup_column_id = NULL )  create_person_column(   name,   ...,   allow_multiple = NULL,   display_as = NULL,   from_type = "peopleOnly" )  create_group_column(   name,   ...,   allow_multiple = NULL,   display_as = NULL,   from_type = "peopleAndGroups" )  create_hyperlink_column(name, ..., is_picture = FALSE)  create_picture_column(name, ..., is_picture = TRUE)  create_thumbnail_column(name, ...)  create_geolocation_column(name, ...)  create_term_column(name, ..., allow_multiple = TRUE, show_full_name = NULL)

title: Create a column definition for use with the create column method for SharePoint lists — create_column_definition
text: name Column name. ... Additional arguments passed create_column_definition() appended end column definition list. .col_type Column type. Defaults "text". Must one "boolean", "calculated", "choice", "currency", "dateTime", "lookup", "number", "personOrGroup", "text", "term", "hyperlinkOrPicture", "thumbnail", "contentApprovalStatus", "geolocation". enforce_unique Enforce unique values column. hidden TRUE, column hidden default. deletable TRUE, column deleted separate list. required TRUE, column required. default Default value set helper get_column_default() function. description Column description. displayname Column display name. multiple_lines Logical. TRUE, allow multiple lines text. append_changes Logical. TRUE, append changes existing value column. lines Whole number. max_length Whole number. Max length number characters. text_type One c("plain", "richText") choices character vector choice options. allow_text TRUE, allow text entry choice column. display_as Value displayed option. create_choice_column one ofc("checkBoxes", "dropDownMenu", "radioButtons"). create_number_column, one c("number", "percentage"). create_datetime_column, one c("default", "friendly", "standard"). allow_na TRUE, allow NA values choices. na_replacement Used replacement stringr::str_replace_na() choices contain NA values. split character vector (object can coerced )     containing regular expression(s) (unless fixed = TRUE)     use splitting.  empty matches occur, particular     split length 0, x split single characters.     split length greater 1, re-cycled along     x. decimals One c("none", "one", "two", "three", "four", "five") numeric value 0 5. max, min Minimum maximum values allowed number column. format "dateOnly" "dateTime". Required create_calculated_column output_type "dateTime" otherwise ignored. locale Locale formula Required string formula calculated column definition. See examples common formulas lists. Reference existing columns using display name enclosed square brackets. formula must start equals sign "=" function appends formula text missing. output_type Value type returned calculated formula. One c("text", "boolean", "currency", "dateTime", "number") lookup_list_column Name lookup column lookup list use. lookup_list_id, lookup_list Lookup list ID string "ms_list" class object id value list properties. allow_multiple TRUE, allow lookup column return multiple values. allow_unlimited_length TRUE, allow lookup column return length value. primary_lookup_column_id column definition secondary column, primary lookup column ID must supplied. from_type type resources choose . Defaults "peopleOnly" create_person_column() "peopleAndGroups" create_group_column() is_picture Logical indicator display hyperlink value link (FALSE, default create_hyperlink_column()) image (TRUE, default create_picture_column()).

title: Create a SharePoint List — create_sp_list
text: create_sp_list() allows creation SharePoint list site. See: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/list-create?view=graph-rest-1.0&tabs=http Note: dashes (`"-"“) list names removed list name retained list display name. update_sp_list() allows modification list display name description. delete_sp_list() deletes existing list requires user confirmation default.

code: create_sp_list(   list_name,   ...,   description = NULL,   columns = NULL,   template = "genericList",   content_types = NULL,   hidden = NULL,   title_definition = list(required = FALSE),   site_url = NULL,   site = NULL,   call = caller_env() )  update_sp_list(   list_name = NULL,   list_id = NULL,   sp_list = NULL,   display_name = NULL,   description = NULL,   ...,   site_url = NULL,   site = NULL,   drive_name = NULL,   drive_id = NULL,   drive = NULL,   call = caller_env() )  delete_sp_list(   list_name = NULL,   list_id = NULL,   sp_list = NULL,   confirm = TRUE,   ...,   site_url = NULL,   site = NULL,   drive_name = NULL,   drive_id = NULL,   drive = NULL,   call = caller_env() )

title: Create a SharePoint List — create_sp_list
text: list_name Required. List name used displayName property. ... Additional parameters passed get_sp_site() Microsoft365R::get_sharepoint_site(). description Optional description. columns Optional. Use create_column_definition() create single column definition use create_column_definition_list() create list column definitions. template Type template use creating list. content_types Optional. Set TRUE contentTypesEnabled enabled. hidden Optional. Set TRUE list hidden. title_definition Named list used update column definition default "Title" column created using "genericList" template. default, makes Title column optional. site_url SharePoint site URL format "https://[tenant name].sharepoint.com/sites/[site name]". SharePoint item document URL can also parsed build site URL using tenant site name included URL. site ms_site object. site supplied, site_url, site_name, site_id ignored. call execution environment currently running function, e.g. caller_env(). function mentioned error messages source error. See call argument abort() information. list_id List ID list update delete. sp_list Microsoft365R::ms_list object. display_name Display name replace existing display name. Used update_sp_list(). drive_name, drive_id SharePoint Drive name ID passed get_drive method SharePoint site object. drive ms_drive object. drive supplied, drive_name drive_id ignored. confirm TRUE, confirm deletion list proceeding.

text: data Required. data frame import items supplied identified SharePoint list. list_name, list_id SharePoint List name ID string. sp_list ms_list object. supplied, list_name, list_id, site_url, site, drive_name, drive_id, drive, additional parameters passed ... ignored. ... Additional parameters passed get_sp_site() Microsoft365R::get_sharepoint_site(). allow_display_nm TRUE, allow data use list field display names instead standard names. Note requires separate API call may result slower request. Default FALSE. .id Column element name item_item value data. Allows users pass modified version list item data id column updated columns. site_url SharePoint site URL format "https://[tenant name].sharepoint.com/sites/[site name]". SharePoint item document URL can also parsed build site URL using tenant site name included URL. site ms_site object. site supplied, site_url, site_name, site_id ignored. drive_name, drive_id SharePoint Drive name ID passed get_drive method SharePoint site object. drive ms_drive object. drive supplied, drive_name drive_id ignored. check_fields TRUE (default), column names input data matched fields list object. FALSE, function error column names matched field supplied SharePoint list. sync_fields TRUE, use sync_fields method sync fields local ms_list object fields SharePoint List source retrieving list metadata. create_list TRUE list_name supplied, new list created using data_as_column_definition_list() set column definitions list. strict yet implemented 2024-08-12. TRUE, column names data must matched field names supplied SharePoint list. FALSE (default), unmatched columns dropped warning. .progress Whether show progress bar. Use TRUE turn basic progress bar, use string give name, see progress_bars details. call execution environment currently running function, e.g. caller_env(). function mentioned error messages source error. See call argument abort() information. drop_fields Column names drop data even listed editable fields. Defaults c("ContentType", "Attachments") .data list data frame fields update. item_id SharePoint list item id. Either item_id sp_list_item must provided . sp_list_item Optional. SharePoint list item object use. na_fields handle NA fields input data. One "drop" (remove NA fields updating list items, leaving existing values place) "replace" (overwrite existing list values new replacement NA values).

title: Download one or more items from SharePoint to a file or folder — download_sp_item
code: # Download a single directory  sp_dir_url <- "<SharePoint directory url>"  new_path <- "local file path"  if (is_sp_url(sp_dir_url)) {   download_sp_item(     sp_dir_url,     new_path = new_path,     recursive = TRUE   ) }  # Batch download multiple directories from a SharePoint Drive  sp_drive_url <- "<SharePoint Drive url>"  if (is_sp_url(sp_drive_url)) {   drive <- get_sp_drive(drive_name = sp_drive_url)    drive_dir_list <- sp_dir_info(     drive = drive,     recurse = TRUE,     type = "dir"   )    download_sp_item(     item_id = drive_dir_list$id,     dest = drive_dir_list$name,     recursive = TRUE,     drive = drive   ) }

title: Parse a SharePoint URL using httr2::url_parse — sp_url_parse
code: sp_url_parse(url, call = caller_env())  sp_url_parse_hostname(hostname, tenant = "[a-zA-Z0-9.-]+", scheme = "https")  sp_url_parse_path(   path,   url_type = "w|x|p|o|b|t|i|v|f|u|li",   permissions = "r|s|t|u|g",   drive_name_prefix = "Shared ",   default_drive_name = "Documents" )  sp_url_parse_query(query)

title: Parse a SharePoint URL using httr2::url_parse — sp_url_parse
text: Types SharePoint URLs SharePoint site URL: https://[tenant].sharepoint.com/sites/[site name] SharePoint document editor URL: https://[tenant].sharepoint.com/:[url type]:/[permissions]/sites/[site name]/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc={[item id]}&file=[file name]&[additional query parameters] SharePoint List URL: https://[tenant].sharepoint.com/sites/[site name]/Lists/[list name]/AllItems.aspx?env=WebViewList https://[tenant].sharepoint.com/:l:/r/sites/[site name]/Lists/[list name] SharePoint folder URL: https://[tenant].sharepoint.com/:[url type]:/[permissions]/sites/[site name]/[drive name (possible "Shared" prefix)]/[folder path]/[folder name]/?[additional query parameters] SharePoint Planner URL: https://tasks.office.com/[tenant].onmicrosoft.com/en-US/Home/Planner/#/plantaskboard?groupId=[Group ID]&planId=[Plan ID] SharePoint Document Library (Drive) URL: https://[tenant].sharepoint.com/sites/[tenant]/[drive name (possible "Shared" prefix)]/Forms/AllItems.aspx

title: sharepointr (development version)
text: Add upload_sp_items() function (2024-06-24). Add vignette reading writing items SharePoint (#9; 2024-07-25). Add update_sp_list_items() function refactor update_sp_list_item() use rlang::list2() rlang::inject() adds support data frame inputs. (2024-08-10) Add display_nm argument list_sp_list_items() allowing use list display names labels replacements field names results. (2024-08-10) Add download_sp_list() (2024-10-10). Add create_column_definition() related functions creating lists equivalent columnDefinition objects. (2025-05-02) Add update_sp_list() limited updates Microsoft List metadata. (2025-07-24) Add purrr imports incorporate new purrr::in_parallel() function. Requires users {crate} mirai installed set workers using mirai::daemons(). (2025-07-25)

title: sharepointr (development version)
text: Fix bug get_sp_list_item() returned item ID, Microsoft365R::ms_list_item object (2024-08-10) Fix bug read_sharepoint() used readr::read_lines() PowerPoint files. (2024-10-10)
